body: @ainilili If this document triggers some misunderstood, I could adjust this in your PR.
But we are moving all supports to 6.x. Could you try to read that?

@ascrutae I noticed this
> assert application[dubbo-provider] operationName: 
 expected:[test.apache.skywalking.apm.testcase.dubbo.services.GreetService.doBusiness()]
 actual: not found

Could you check the test case pr? Is he missing something?

@wu-sheng I just find three component-libraries.yaml

oap-server\server-starter\src\main\resources\component-libraries.yml
oap-server\server-core\src\test\resources\component-libraries.yml
docker\config\component-libraries.yml

Can you help me find another one?

```
If it was sent cross-thread:
 - Ignore ContextCarrier and work with ContextSnapshot

If it was sent cross-process
 - Use ContextCarrier
```

This is ideal status, but the more complex scenario is for span. If you call exit span, then the target ip would be required, and shown in topology if no entry span created. Also I doubt you would know when to create exit span or local span for in-process.

> Currently sending a message always creates an ExitSpan and sends the ContextCarrier and receiving a message always creates a EntrySpan using the ContextCarrier sent.

This could be an easier way. But I have a question,  if you don't know whether this event goes out-of-process or not, how set you set peer?
Yes. Only 3.

> Question 2:
oap config -sampleRate, means trace sampled within one milisecond?

We have detailed document about server side sampling. https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/trace-sampling.md
Is `SmartSql` a client-side component? Does it need a mapping to set server type?

@wu-sheng 
SmartSql is the same as MyBaitis. It is not possible to determine which DB the user will end up using. so the server type cannot be mapped.
OK. Make sense.

Relate to https://github.com/SkyAPM/SkyAPM-dotnet/pull/167

@peng-yongsheng Do we need to add filter mechanism based on metric_name list? If yes, I could do this in further PR.

I don't know what happens in your `datasource management dependency`. But in my mind, the connection needs to be enhanced, because when trace happens, it will obtain the connection info(jdbc url, username...) from it, but the connection doesn't open method for this.

> I don't know what happens in your `datasource management dependency`. But in my mind, the connection needs to be enhanced, because when trace happens, it will obtain the connection info(jdbc url, username...) from it, but the connection doesn't open method for this.

Thank you for your reply, more than that, I want to know the place where JDBC4Connection is identified to be enhanced, could you offer a guide.
@dsc6636926 @ascrutae Do you know? I don't know this detail

@guyukou Which driver class of MySQL JDBC did you used in your project?  if the driver class is not in enhance list, the connection object that the driver object return will not an `EnhancedInstance` object.

> @guyukou Which driver class of MySQL JDBC did you used in your project? if the driver class is not in enhance list, the connection object that the driver object return will not an `EnhancedInstance` object.

Indeed, we use the `com.mysql.jdbc.Driver`, however, the connection pool lib is one that encapsulates alibaba druid and set a proxy to JDBC4Connection.

Which version of SkyWalking do you use? JDBC4Connection is subclass of com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl , and com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl has been enhanced . so JDBC4Connection is enhanced too. can you tell me the exactly problem you have met?
If this JDBC4Connection is a proxy object, it could not be enhanced by Skywalking.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15632270/54808966-c5f15180-4cbc-11e9-8edd-63934ae844ab.png)
This is a screenshot from my local debug env, and it will cause a ClassCastException as beblow.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15632270/54809014-f0dba580-4cbc-11e9-956a-d45a0f93b77b.png)
@dsc6636926

this issue looks like #1947 ,and i found you use LoadBalanced mode,this version of skywalking is not support multihost mode on mysqlconnector-5.x. it will be fixed on next version.
on multihost mode, Connection will be created by LoadBalancedConnectionProxy.createInstance, connection will be proxied,so  the connection could not be enhanced by Skywalking, then the ClassCastException will be thrown

> this issue looks like #1947 ,and i found you use LoadBalanced mode,this version of skywalking is not support multihost mode on mysqlconnector-5.x. it will be fixed on next version.
> on multihost mode, Connection will be created by LoadBalancedConnectionProxy.createInstance, connection will be proxied,so the connection could not be enhanced by Skywalking, then the ClassCastException will be thrown

Thank you, I got it.
@candyleer From https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/issues/629#issuecomment-474058254, I think the safe action we should take, should be that remove it directly. Agree?

I think you should take our k8s config as an example, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-kubernetes/blob/master/6/6.0.0-GA/oap/03-deployment.yml#L55-L61

You could mount the volume to inject the config. The config files in k8s are here, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-kubernetes/blob/master/6/6.0.0-GA/oap/01-config.yml

Coverage remained the same at 13.763% when pulling **bd05e33f4f5e47435b6014aee7889cd73674fcc1 on wrong-inst-name** into **975a06d1633778c571ddbb10aeb539acf8176929 on master**.

@wu-sheng, why do you think it will be hard to tell whether or not to make an exit span vs a local span? I'm able to detect whether the message is going over the wire or being routed locally pretty easily. If it's going over the wire I use `ContextCarrier` and if it's not I use `ContextSnapshot`.

I'm a bit confused on how I should be handling the local routing scenario. For an example scenario, let's say I have a local message flow of: `A` -> `B` -> `C` (where `A` sends a message to `B` and so on) and that in turn triggers a response flow of: `C` -> `B` -> `A`  (where `C` responds to `B` and so on).

In this scenario, do I create any entry or exit spans or are they all supposed to be local? Your question about what I set the peer to set me down this path. Technically there wouldn't be a peer here because it's just communicating with itself. So should I just be creating a local spans?

If the answer is yes, would the process be:
 - create async local span when `A` calls `B`
 - create local span when `B` receives message from `A` (call continued with `A` context)
 - create async local span when `B` calls `C`
 - create local span when `C` receives message from `B` (call continued with `B` context)
 - close async local span when `C` responds to `B`
 - close async local span when `B` responds to `A`

I think I've got the over the wire scenario covered. It's the simple:
 - create exit span when sending messages
 - create entry span when receiving messages

> I'm able to detect whether the message is going over the wire or being routed locally pretty easily

If you can detect that, so you should do as you described above. 

Just remind
1. In real local, ContextSnapshot is required between AsyncA and ReceiverB
1. In `over the wire scenario`, you also need async span. 

My original questions are mostly about when you can't know it is local or remote when span is created. But look like you know. So, you could ignore my questions.

> @peng-yongsheng Do we need to add filter mechanism based on metric_name list? If yes, I could do this in further PR.

I think it is necessary.  Maybe subscribe the metrics which the 3rd party need when connect to the target server is a good idea.

> @peng-yongsheng Could you answer this?
> 
> > Question 1:
> > ES as storage, I found the es config was not effect, for example, I set flushInterval 120s, bu I found only after seconds the bulk had executed

@ywf4026 Good question. This is a transaction problem. Workers will combine the data in memory with the data in db. The flow is: 

ForEach memory data -> Get the same key data in memory -> combine memory and db -> into bulk process -> flush

So, if I don't flush it into db, I will get the dirty data from db next cycle. The bulk process settings are use for avoid send too many or too big size data into db, shred the sent data packet.
Yes,I agree with that, since bytebuddy do not  rely on this file and  it is not usable in most environment .
@candyleer Please submit pull request to fix this.

@kezhenxu94 I think we need to update supported list document. Add Apache dubbo in the rpc list. Could you do that?

@wu-sheng, is it necessary to open a local span when you're just closing an async local span?

Without opening another local I have this:
 - Exit span from process A
 - Entry span from process B

If I open a local span when I'm closing the async local spans, I end up with this:
 - Exit span from process A
 - Entry span from process B
 - Local span from process B to close Entry span
 - Local span from process A to close Exit span

Those local spans end up looking like:
```json
{
  "segmentId": "1.215.15537264330420004",
  "spans": [
    {
      "operationName": "__vertx.reply.4b5d4eb7-5323-4532-aa03-4a6cec875f23",
      "operationId": "0",
      "parentSpanId": "-1",
      "spanId": "0",
      "spanLayer": "RPCFramework",
      "refs": [
        {
          "parentEndpointId": 0,
          "parentEndpoint": "cluster-message-receiver",
          "networkAddressId": 0,
          "entryEndpointId": 0,
          "refType": "CrossThread",
          "parentSpanId": 0,
          "parentTraceSegmentId": "1.215.15537264330100002",
          "parentServiceInstanceId": 1,
          "networkAddress": "",
          "entryEndpoint": "cluster-message-receiver",
          "entryServiceInstanceId": 1
        }
      ],
      "startTime": "1553726433042",
      "endTime": "1553726433052",
      "componentId": "59",
      "componentName": "",
      "isError": false,
      "spanType": "Local",
      "peer": "",
      "peerId": "0"
    }
  ]
}
```
I think they always end up being in their own segment.


I believe you said before that I needed to open local spans when receiving messages because during that process the trace context could be picked up by other plugins. Does that still apply with async spans though? The point at which I'm closing the span is when the message is being responded to. I can't think of something that would need to pick up the context at that point.

If I do need to create the local spans when I'm closing async local spans, what would you recommend for naming them? When I send a message to `X` and I'm waiting for a response, Vert.x generates `__vertx.reply` so it can route back. If I need those local spans can I keep the operation name like the JSON above? I didn't see any other integrations tests with dynamic operation names so I imagine not.

> I see that the DataCarrier in TraceSegmentServiceClient uses BufferStrategy.IF_POSSIBLE, so some segment will lose if there is too many segments to send. So is there other situations in which segment will lose?

No. 

> If I change the sampleRate from 1000 to 100, only payload of segment persisting will reduce to 10%, right?

If you are saying client sampling, yes. Also the metric values lose 90%.

> How many CPM can one backend server load(Simply 8 cpu), and how can I compute how many backend servers should the cluster include?

Depend on ElasticSearch performance. 8 CPU could reach 5k/s at least.
For 6.0.0-GA, it is designed for >~16Core. And 6.1 release(haven't yet) will be good work at different CPU cores.
Wait for community help or from @terrymanu 's team.
I am just tagging this as `help wanted`, because no committer is working on this.

> is it necessary to open a local span when you're just closing an async local span?

Anything else you will or plan to do when/after close async local span? If no, no need. Local span only makes sense when you want to do more thing, and try to build the link by ref(ContextSnapshot)

What do you mean by metric values? I think CPM value is still the exact value as sampleRate just impacts SegmentSpanListener for segment persistence.

For server-side sampling, yes. Your description looks right.

> What about mysql? I think mysql is not optimized .

We are running over tens of millions segment per day, so elasticsearch is widely used by us. For MySQL, I have added some indexes. If you have any new suggestion, pull request is always welcome.
